com.galou.moodtracker.controllers.fragments

Class HistoryFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.galou.moodtracker.controllers.fragments.HistoryFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, MoodAdapter.Listener

    public class HistoryFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements MoodAdapter.Listener
    Represent a Fragment History

    Contains a RecyclerView that displays a history of the user's moods A Fragment subclass Implements the interface Listener from MoodAdapter used as a callback to know when a user click on an element of the RecyclerView

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    galou
    See Also:
    HistoryActivity, MoodBank, MoodAdapter, Fragment

        RecyclerView that displays the mood history from the user

      • onClickCommentButton

        public void onClickCommentButton(int position)
        Actions when the user click on the button Comment from one of the element of the RecyclerView

        Override method from the interface MoodAdapter.Listener Create a Toast that displays the mood comment on which the user clicked

        Specified by:
        onClickCommentButton in interface MoodAdapter.Listener
        Parameters:
        position - position in the moodBank list of the mood

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Actions executed when the fragment is created

      • inflate with the layout
      • Bind views with ButterKnife
      • set the Activity name that contains the fragment
      • set the moodBank list to display it on the RecyclerView
      • set the size of the screen
      • configure the RecyclerView with an adapter and the data to display

Overrides:
onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
Parameters:
inflater - layout inflater
container - fragment container
savedInstanceState - saved state of the fragment
Returns:
view inflated
